channel.title: AI Native Accounting - Digits
channel.description: Hosted by Kacee Johnson, fintech innovation leader and Principal at Radical, AI-Native Accounting is the podcast at the crossroads of AI and the future of finance. Engage in monthly discussions with firm owners, tech pioneers, and visionary accountants.

item.title: Why Younger CPAs Are Essential to AI Readiness
item.description: The CEO of Public Accounting at the AICPA shares why responsible, auditable AI is a non-negotiable for the profession—exploring the guardrails, talent shifts, and mindset changes CPA firms need to innovate without compromising trust or standards.
item.content:encoded:
What does responsible AI look like inside the world’s most trusted profession?


Susan S. Coffey, CEO of Public Accounting at the AICPA, joins Kacee Johnson to explore the non-negotiable guardrails for AI in accounting and how the profession can innovate without compromising its standards.


They also get into:


• Why AI in accounting must remain auditable


• Why reverse mentoring with younger professionals accelerates AI fluency across firms


• How CPA education is shifting from knowledge to application

item.title: From Bookkeeping to Advisory: How Top Firms Reposition CAS for Growth
item.description: A senior CAS leader from one of the country’s top advisory firms breaks down how disciplined, transparent AI adoption is becoming the defining advantage for accounting practices trying to scale beyond bookkeeping.
item.content:encoded:
CAS practices are growing 30% annually. But most firms still can't scale past bookkeeping.


In this episode, Kane Polakoff, Partner and CAS Practice Leader at CohnReznick, shares how they are approaching AI adoption with discipline, transparency, and professional responsibility.


In this episode, we cover:


  • The AI question clients are already asking firms
  • How and when to be transparent about AI use
  • Why CAS growth often slows inside firms
  • What drives sustainable CAS growth at scale

Get this right, and you'll build client trust competitors can't replicate.

item.title: The Trifecta: 2030 Playbook for CPAs with Jeff, Dan & Craig
item.description: Three of the most influential builders in modern accounting software explain the shift every firm will feel as AI reshapes the profession, both in the near term and the decade ahead.
item.content:encoded:
Three of the most influential builders in modern accounting software explain the shift every firm will feel as AI reshapes the profession, both in the near term and the decade ahead.


In this episode, Dan Wernikoff (Intuit QuickBooks), Craig Walker (Digits), and Jeff Seibert (Digits) sit down with Kacee Johnson to break down what’s actually coming next.


You’ll hear them discuss:


  • How AI goes far beyond the cloud shift accountants lived through
  • The automation of month-end close expected by 2026
  • What 96% AI accuracy actually means for bookkeeping and review
  • What is expected of accountants as firms go AI-native by 2030

item.title: The Transformation Economy: A CPA’s Guide
item.description: Join host Kacee Johnson and Ron Baker, co-founder of Threshold, as they reframe AI’s role in accounting around “outcome-focused” firms—designing for long-term transformations (not hours), narrowing scope to boost effectiveness, tracking time saved/invested and transformation KPIs, and tying financial guidance to broader goals like health, purpose, and human flourishing.
item.content:encoded:
As AI accelerates work automation, how do accounting firms prove their value?
Ron Baker, co-founder of Threshold, joins Kacee Johnson to explore ‘outcome focused accounting’.
In this episode, they dive into:
• designing firms around long term transformations rather than hours.
• why trying to be all things to all clients undermines firm effectiveness.
• tracking client impact through time saved, time invested, and transformation KPIs.
• linking financial guidance to clients’ broader aspirations like health and purpose

item.title: Low-Code AI: The Future of Accounting?
item.description: Join host Kacee Johnson and Joe Woodard, founder & CEO of Woodard Group, as they explore how accountants can move past AI skepticism and take practical steps to integrate automation, uncovering decade-long efficiency gains, global disruption trends, and the human connections no algorithm can replace.
item.content:encoded:
On AI Native Accounting, Kacee Johnson sits down with Joe Woodard, founder & CEO of Woodard Group and trainer of 125,000+ accounting professionals, as they explore ways accountants can move past skepticism and take practical steps to integrate AI into their workflows.


  • How low-code AI tools replicate a decade of manual efficiency gains
  • Global trends showing which countries and firms will face the sharpest disruption
  • Why accounting, like the ministerial profession, hinges on connections that no algorithm can replace

item.title: AI-fying Accounting: What Every CPA & CFO Must Know
item.description: Join host Kacee Johnson and Lindsay Stevenson as they explore BPM’s journey from AI curiosity to 80% daily Copilot usage, uncovering grassroots wins, broken systems, and what late adopters should focus on now.
item.content:encoded:
On AI-Native Accounting this month, host Kacee Johnson sits down with Lindsay Stevenson, Chief Transformation Officer at BPM (Top 50), to unpack how her teams moved from curiosity with AI to ~80% daily Copilot usage and what broke along the way.


  • Grassroots rollout that beat a formal “AI committee”
  • How BPM handles duplicated agents, ROI, and a faster intake than the PMO
  • What late adopters should do this quarter

item.title: Balancing Tech and Human Touch in Accounting with Dan Luthi
item.description: Join host Kacee Johnson and Dan Luthi as they dive into AI's impact on accounting, exploring tech-driven transformations and the essential balance of automation with the human touch.
item.content:encoded:
Join host Kacee Johnson for the second episode of AI-Native Accounting, featuring an engaging conversation with Dan Luthi, Partner at Ignite Spot. Dive into how AI is revolutionizing the accounting profession, from enhancing daily operations to elevating client services.


Dan shares his experiences working with diverse businesses and his involvement in advisory boards that shape cutting-edge accounting tools. Discover actionable strategies to modernize your practice, improve efficiency, and boost profitability. This episode is a treasure trove of insights for accountants and firm owners ready to harness the power of AI.

item.title: Stay Curious & Stay Ahead with Matt Gardner + Dawn Brolin
item.description: Join host Kacee Johnson with experts Dawn Brolin and Matt Gardner as they explore AI's real-world impact on accounting and how they've been implementing it to modernize their practices.
item.content:encoded:
Join host Kacee Johnson for AI-Native Accounting's inaugural episode, recorded live at Scaling New Heights.


She sits down with Dawn Brolin, CEO of Powerful Accounting Inc., and Matt Gardner, Co-Founder & CEO of Hiline. Together, they explore the practical impact of AI on firms, discussing real-world applications and benefits they're seeing and using today.


Discover how AI is being integrated into everyday tasks and decision-making processes. With valuable insights and advice for accountants + firm owners, this episode is a must-listen for anyone looking to modernize their practice.
